VendorDialogue.text: Hello, i am the vendor, unfortunately my features are not implemented yet.

options.text: Oh
Goodbye!

VendorDialogue.text: Yeah, sorry, im sure the developer will get to it soon (wink).

options.text: Goodbye!

VillainDialogue.text: Ah, the brave hero arrives at last. Tell me, what makes you think you can stop me when so many have failed?

options.text: [Defiant] Because I fight for those who can't fight for themselves. That's something you'll never understand.
[Curious]: Why do you do this? What could you possibly gain from destroying so much?
[Taunting]: You're just another tyrant hiding behind power. I've beaten worse.
[Empathetic]: This isn't who you really are, is it? You don't have to go through with this.

VillainDialogue.text: Ah, the noble defender, so predictable. Courage won't save you when I unleash my full power!

options.text: [Determined]: Then I'll stop you, no matter the cost!
[Insightful]: You're not proving anything except that you're scared of letting go.
[Provocative]: Big words for someone about to lose everything.
[Sympathetic]: The world hurt you, but hurting it back won't heal you. Let me help.

VillainDialogue.text:
Enough of this! Words won't change what must be done. Prepare yourself, hero! 
 this is supposed to lead to an epic showdown but i forgot to implement that so could you pleas type "attack villain" and pretend this didnt happen? thanks :3
Gain? It's not about gain. It's about proving that order is a lie. Chaos is the only truth.

options.text: [Determined]: Then I'll stop you, no matter the cost!
[Insightful]: You're not proving anything except that you're scared of letting go.
[Provocative]: Big words for someone about to lose everything.
[Sympathetic]: The world hurt you, but hurting it back won't heal you. Let me help.

VillainDialogue.text: You think you're clever? I'll show you why the others never stood a chance!

options.text: [Determined]: Then I'll stop you, no matter the cost!
[Insightful]: You're not proving anything except that you're scared of letting go.
[Provocative]: Big words for someone about to lose everything.
[Sympathetic]: The world hurt you, but hurting it back won't heal you. Let me help.

VillainDialogue.text: [Pauses] Don't presume to know me, hero. This world made me this way, and I’ll make it pay.

options.text: [Determined]: Then I'll stop you, no matter the cost!
[Insightful]: You're not proving anything except that you're scared of letting go.
[Provocative]: Big words for someone about to lose everything.
[Sympathetic]: The world hurt you, but hurting it back won't heal you. Let me help.

FishDialogue.text: Ah, the brave wanderer approaches. Speak, and I shall illuminate the depths of your ponderings.

options.text: What do you eat?
Why are you in this pond?
How are you talking?
Can you help me find the artifact?

FishDialogue.text: Ah, sustenance! I partake in the humble offerings of this aqueous abode, where the smallest morsels—those microscopic architects of life's intricate tapestry—sustain my existence.

options.text: Can you... just give me a straight answer?
Are you saying everything happens for a reason?

FishDialogue.text: Why, indeed! My presence here is as the stone upon the riverbed: a circumstance of cosmic alignment, a testament to the gentle insistence of fate's guiding currents.

options.text: Can you... just give me a straight answer?
Are you saying everything happens for a reason?

FishDialogue.text: A question that echoes through the caverns of curiosity! Know this: the limitations of form are but illusions crafted by the mind. In truth, I am no more bound by silence than the stars are by darkness.

options.text: Can you... just give me a straight answer?
Do you always talk like this, or am I just lucky?

FishDialogue.text: Seek you the object of power, the trinket imbued with the dreams of ancients? Perhaps its path is known to me, for the waters whisper secrets to those who listen with patient hearts.

options.text: Where exactly *is* the artifact?
Do you always talk like this, or am I just lucky?

FishDialogue.text: Simplicity is a treasure seldom found in life's labyrinth. Yet, for you, seeker of clarity, I shall attempt brevity: I do not know.

options.text: You're... something else. Thanks, I think.

FishDialogue.text: Indeed, each ripple upon the water's surface reflects the infinite interplay of cause and consequence. To embrace this is to swim freely in the currents of existence.

options.text: You're... something else. Thanks, I think.

FishDialogue.text: Ah, my verbosity! 'Tis but the natural cadence of a being who dwells amidst the poetry of the waves and the symphony of the stream.

options.text: You're... something else. Thanks, I think.

FishDialogue.text: In the shadow of the tallest peak, where the sun kisses the earth, lies the gateway to your heart's desire. But beware: what glitters is not always gold.

options.text: Tallest peak, huh? Got it. Thanks for the help!

FishDialogue.text: Farewell, seeker. May your journey be as profound as the waters that cradle my wisdom.

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny looks at you with wide eyes, twitching its nose expectantly.

options.text: Where is the treasure?
What are you doing here?
Can you guide me out of this forest?

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny tilts its head and lets out a series of high-pitched squeaks: 'Squeak! Squeak-squeak!'

options.text: What does that even mean?
Okay... let’s try this again. Where is the treasure?

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny flops onto its side lazily, squeaking softly: 'Squeak. Squeak?'

options.text: Are you even paying attention?
Fine, just ignore me then.

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny stands up on its hind legs, looks at you seriously for a moment, and squeaks loudly: 'SQUEAK!'

options.text: Is that a yes or a no?
You’re not very helpful, are you?

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny wiggles its ears and lets out another string of indecipherable squeaks: 'Squeak-squeak! Squeakity squeak!'

options.text: I give up.

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny hops in a small circle before squeaking twice: 'Squeak-squeak!' It seems pleased with itself.

options.text: I’m starting to think you’re just messing with me.

BunnyDialogue.text: The bunny hops away a few steps, then looks back at you with a mischievous twitch of its nose.
The bunny squeaks again, slightly louder this time, before hopping around excitedly. 'SQUEAK-SQUEAK!'

options.text: I’ll just figure it out myself. Thanks, I guess.
